org.magnos.asset
Interface AssetSource

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseAssetSource, ClasspathSource, DatabaseSource, FileSource, FtpSource, JarSource, MulticastSource, SmartSource, SslSource, TcpSource, UdpSource, WebSource
public interface AssetSource

A source to retrieve assets from. A source is given requests and its responsible for validating it, determining the absolute path to the requested object, and finally returning an InputStream to parse the request.

Author:
Philip Diffenderfer

Method Summary
 String getAbsolute(String request)
          Returns the absolute path to the request within this source.
 String getBase()
          The base where the assets are loaded from.
 InputStream getStream(String request)
          Returns an InputStream to the requested asset.
 boolean isPresent(String request)
          Returns whether the given request exists in this source.
 boolean isValid(String request)
          Returns true if the request given is in valid format.
 

Method Detail

isValid

boolean isValid(String request)
Returns true if the request given is in valid format. This will validate against the absolute path to the request.

Parameters:
request - The request to validate.
Returns:
True if the request is valid for this source, otherwise false.

getAbsolute

String getAbsolute(String request)
Returns the absolute path to the request within this source. This is typically a combination between the base of this source and the request.

Parameters:
request - The request to compute the absolute path of.
Returns:
The absolute path of the request.

getBase

String getBase()
The base where the assets are loaded from. This is effectively prepended to each request string.

Returns:
The reference to the base String.

isPresent

boolean isPresent(String request)
Returns whether the given request exists in this source. This does not determine if the asset is in the proper format however, it only returns whether something with the given request exists. The default implementation will try to create the stream and return true if the stream was created without error. Implementing classes should override this functionality to something more efficient.

Parameters:
request - The request to check for existence.
Returns:
True if the request exists at the source or false if it does not.

getStream

InputStream getStream(String request)
                      throws Exception
Returns an InputStream to the requested asset. If the asset doesn't exist in this source then an exception will be thrown or null will be returned depending on the implementation.

Parameters:
request - The request for the asset.
Returns:
The reference to InputStream containing the requested asset, or null if the request was invalid.
Throws:
Exception - An error occurred retrieving the asset from the source.
